Row.Text: A lord inspects the deed to a miniscule plot of land gifted to him by a noble. The noble smirks, expecting a grand display of appreciation for the insulting offer. Knowing he is lower in the hierarchy of bones, the lord is careful with his tongue.
The farmhands will be happy to have less work.
Much more land would have just gone to waste.

Wearing gold jewelry and smelling of ginseng, an aristocrat admires her acres of land. Across the horizon are fields tended by her neighbors, on plots granted to them by the royal family just like her. Property equals power, and the aristocrat wants for more.

A sea of adolescent men stand perfectly still, awaiting orders. Born from aristocracy, this new class of Hwarang uphold a chivalric oath to fight, protect, and spread their faith. The looming threat of an enemy army tests their combat readiness.

Accompanied by a crescendo of music, dancers move with each word sung by the writer. Every stanza is joined by a flourish of song and dance, expressing a story of hope. As she sings the final line, her voice booms and reverberates through the theater.

A foreign trader approaches the merchant's booth, eyeing several gold items for sale. The precious metals reflect off his skin, casting him in an ethereal glow. He must bring something magnificent back home to resell at his stall.
Golden accessories that show off beauty.
Golden belts that show off wealth.
Young stablehands tend to a pregnant mare. As they work on her hooves, a clap of thunder startles them all. The two men look up at the clear sky-- could this be a sign?
It signals a child was born to lead new discoveries.
It means a child was born who will usher in prosperity.

Times have changed, bringing a new way to put the dead to rest. Stamped with flowers and coated in a green glaze, a tiny urn waits to be finished in the kiln. A bell rings in the distance, signaling...
Monarchs and aristocrats clash as tensions rise over land claims and marriage prospects. As houses claw for power, common folk suffer at the hands of the rich.
Commoners work efficiently when given small comforts.
As upheaval ripples across Silla, little room is left for nuanced discussion. Disagreements about who should rule, and how, will only be resolved on the battlefield.
A firm hand can quash any uprising.
These are the mewlings of cubs.
The Good Doctor, On Bended Knee

Roaming the capital of Silla, Dr. Rizal finds himself in the midst of a royal procession. Just as a guard attempts to remove him, he catches the sun's glint off a man's magnificent gold and jade crown.
These are a prosperous people to have such finery.
There is a great power embedded in that crown.
